meanings.definition: To search or look for something
meanings.sent1: The detective scouths the crime scene for clues.
meanings.sent2: I always scouth the library for interesting books to read.
meanings.sent3: The cat scouths the house for its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scouth the crowd, searching for her lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The explorer scouths the jungle, seeking hidden treasures.

meanings.definition: A group of young people involved in scouting
meanings.sent1: The scouths gathered around the campfire to sing songs.
meanings.sent2: My brother joined the scouths to learn outdoor skills.
meanings.sent3: The scouths had a fun time hiking in the woods.
meanings.sent4: The scouths helped an elderly neighbor with yard work.
meanings.sent5: The scouths proudly wore their uniforms during the parade.

meanings.sent1: The wind scouths through the trees on a stormy night.
meanings.sent2: The athlete scouths across the finish line, winning the race.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scouths up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: Time scouths by when you're having fun with friends.
meanings.sent5: The car scouths down the highway, reaching top speed.
